channel.title: Reuters: World News
channel.description: Reuters.com is your source for breaking news, business, financial and investing news, including personal finance and stocks. Reuters is the leading global provider of news, financial information and technology solutions to the world's media, financial institutions, businesses and individuals.
channel.copyright: All rights reserved. Users may download and print extracts of content from this website for their own personal and non-commercial use only. item.title: Peru withdrawing ambassador from Chile over spying accusations
item.description: LIMA (Reuters) - Peru said on Saturday it was withdrawing its ambassador from Chile, amid an intensifying diplomatic spat that was sparked by accusations of military espionage.

item.title: Colombia, FARC rebels agree to remove landmines
item.description: HAVANA (Reuters) - The Colombian government and leftist guerrillas on Saturday jointly announced an agreement to remove landmines and other explosives from the battlefield in a sign of progress in their two-year-old peace talks being held in Cuba.

item.title: Friendly fire kills one, wounds three from U.S.-led coalition in Iraq
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - One member of the U.S.-led coalition fighting Islamic State was killed and three were wounded in a friendly fire incident with Kurdish forces in northern Iraq, the U.S. military said on Saturday.

item.title: Militants kill five in attack on restaurant in Mali capital
item.description: BAMAKO (Reuters) - Militants killed five people including a French citizen and a Belgian security officer in a gun attack on a restaurant in Mali's capital in the early hours of Saturday, authorities said.

item.title: Four bombs in Nigeria's Maiduguri city kill at least 50
item.description: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria (Reuters) - Four bomb blasts killed at least 50 people in Maiduguri in Nigeria's northeast on Saturday in the worst attacks there since Islamist militants tried to seize the city in two major assaults earlier this year.

item.title: Saudi Arabia rejects rights criticism after flogging of blogger
item.description: RIYADH (Reuters) - Saudi Arabia defended its human rights record on Saturday in its first public reaction to international criticism over last year's sentencing of liberal Saudi blogger Raif Badawi to 1,000 lashes and 10 years in jail for "insulting Islam".

item.title: Iraq says Islamic State militants raze ancient Hatra city
item.description: BAGHDAD/ERBIL,Iraq (Reuters) - Islamic State militants have destroyed ancient remains of the 2,000-year-old city of Hatra in northern Iraq, officials said on Saturday, in their latest attack on Iraqi antiquities which the United Nations condemned as barbarism.

item.title: Iraqi troops battle to advance in towns on edge of Tikrit
item.description: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Iraqi security forces and Shi'ite militia fighters struggled to advance on Saturday into the two towns of al-Alam and al-Dour near Tikrit, their progress slowed by fierce defense from Islamic State militants.

item.title: Six killed in gunmen attack on Sufi place of worship in Kabul
item.description: KABUL (Reuters) - Attackers with guns fixed with silencers killed six people after storming a Sufi place of worship in the Afghan capital Kabul on Saturday evening, according to a government statement.

item.title: Czech, Austrian, others missing after Libya oilfield attack
item.description: PRAGUE/TRIPOLI (Reuters) - Around 10 foreigners are missing after an attack on a Libyan oil field and there is a possibility they have been taken hostage, Czech Foreign Minister Lubomir Zaoralek said on Saturday.

item.title: Two detained after grenade explodes outside Bangkok court
item.description: BANGKOK (Reuters) - Thai police detained two people for questioning on Saturday after a grenade exploded outside a criminal court in Bangkok.

item.title: Israel fires at Gaza boats, kills Palestinian fisherman: hospital officials
item.description: GAZA (Reuters) - The Israeli navy opened fire on boats off the coast of the Gaza Strip on Saturday, killing one Palestinian fisherman, Gaza hospital officials said.

item.title: U.S., France 'on same page' over Iran, want stronger deal
item.description: PARIS (Reuters) - The United States and France sought on Saturday to play down any disagreements over nuclear talks with Iran, saying they both agreed the accord now under discussion needed to be strengthened.

item.title: Syrian air strike kills two Islamic State commanders
item.description: BEIRUT (Reuters) - The Syrian army has killed two Islamic State commanders in an air strike in central Syria along with at least 24 other members of the ultra-hardline group, a monitoring group said on Saturday.

item.title: UK police defend actions over teenage girls who flew to Syria
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - British police on Saturday denied accusations that they had failed to pass on crucial information that could have allowed families to stop three teenage girls from traveling to Syria to join Islamic State militants.

item.title: Spain arrests Moroccan woman suspected of trying to join Islamic State
item.description: MADRID (Reuters) - Spanish authorities on Saturday arrested a Moroccan woman resident in Spain on suspicion of attempting to join Islamic State militants in Syria, the interior ministry said.

item.title: Two suspects held over murder of Kremlin critic Nemtsov
item.description: MOSCOW (Reuters) - Two suspects have been detained over the killing of Boris Nemtsov, Russian officials said, a week after he was shot dead near the Kremlin in the most high-profile killing of an opposition figure in years.

item.title: Libyan Islamist leader backs U.N. talks, but tensions high
item.description: TRIPOLI (Reuters) - An influential Islamist supporter of Libya's self-declared government said United Nations talks were the only way to end the country's conflict, but signaled a deal would be hard while a rival government works with a former ally of Muammar Gaddafi.

item.title: Director calls banning rape documentary 'international suicide' for India
item.description: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - India committed "international suicide" by banning a documentary about the gang rape and murder of a woman in Delhi, the director of the film said after a Friday night screening in London.

item.title: Germany downplays report of rift with NATO over Breedlove comments
item.description: BERLIN/RIGA (Reuters) - German Foreign Minister Frank-Walter Steinmeier downplayed a magazine report on Saturday of tensions with NATO over hawkish comments about Ukraine made by the Western alliance's supreme allied commander.
